Html:
The installation seemed to work ok (2nd time around).

I can open the dialogues, mark the text ; when I invoke the redact function I get the message

"An error was encountered while redacting this document"

The marked sections remain, but no redacting is done.

I had "Word 2003 redaction" module installed from a previous Office2003 installation;

I removed it, de-installed Word2007 Redaction Tool and re-installed it. Same problem.

I'm running Office 2007 French ; could that be the cause of the problem ?

Normand
Definitely shouldn't be - does this happen with every document you try to redact (i.e. a new blank document with no text), or just with a specific document?

Yes, I tried with an existing document and a new one.

This morning, while opening up Word, I get the following message :

Name: Word 2007 Redaction Tool

From: file:///C:/DOCUME~1/Montour.IRO/LOCALS~1/Temp/WZSE0.TMP/Word 2007 Redaction Tool.vsto

Customized functionality in this program will not work because one or more of the files for the following customization cannot be found: Word 2007 Redaction Tool. Uninstall the customization from the Add or Remove Programs dialog box in Control Panel, and then install the customization from the following location: file:///C:/DOCUME~1/Montour.IRO/LOCALS~1/Temp/WZSE0.TMP/Word 2007 Redaction Tool.vsto.

************** Exception Text **************

Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Deployment.OfflineAddInFailedException: Customized functionality in this program will not work because one or more of the files for the following customization cannot be found: Word 2007 Redaction Tool. Uninstall the customization from the Add or Remove Programs dialog box in Control Panel, and then install the customization from the following location: file:///C:/DOCUME~1/Montour.IRO/LOCALS~1/Temp/WZSE0.TMP/Word 2007 Redaction Tool.vsto. ---> System.IO.FileNotFoundException: Le fichier spécifié est introuvable. (Exception de HRESULT : 0x80070002)

à System.Deployment.Internal.Isolation.IsolationInterop.CreateActContext(CreateActContextParameters& Params)

à System.Deployment.Internal.Isolation.IsolationInterop.CreateActContext(IDefinitionAppId AppId)

à System.ActivationContext.CreateFromName(ApplicationIdentity applicationIdentity)

à System.ActivationContext.CreatePartialActivationContext(ApplicationIdentity identity)

à Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Deployment.ClickOnceAddInDeploymentManager.HandleOffline(IClickOnceAddInInstaller addInInstaller, String applicationIdentity, Uri deploymentManifestUri, String productName)

--- Fin de la trace de la pile d'exception interne ---

à Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Deployment.ClickOnceAddInDeploymentManager.HandleOffline(IClickOnceAddInInstaller addInInstaller, String applicationIdentity, Uri deploymentManifestUri, String productName)

à Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Deployment.ClickOnceAddInDeploymentManager.GetManifests(TimeSpan timeout)

à Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Deployment.ClickOnceAddInDeploymentManager.InstallAddIn()

I tried to uninstall it and I cannot find it in the list of software in the "Add/suppress software" in configuration.

When trying to reinstall, I get this message :

Name:

From: file:///E:/NormandMontour/Test/Caviardage/Outils/CodePlex Word 2007 Redaction Tool/Word 2007 Redaction Tool.vsto

The customization cannot be installed because another version is currently installed and cannot be upgraded from this location. To install this version of the customization, first use Add or Remove Programs to uninstall this program: Word 2007 Redaction Tool. Then install the new customization from the following location: file:///E:/NormandMontour/Test/Caviardage/Outils/CodePlex Word 2007 Redaction Tool/Word 2007 Redaction Tool.vsto

************** Exception Text **************

Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Deployment.AddInAlreadyInstalledException: The customization cannot be installed because another version is currently installed and cannot be upgraded from this location. To install this version of the customization, first use Add or Remove Programs to uninstall this program: Word 2007 Redaction Tool. Then install the new customization from the following location: file:///E:/NormandMontour/Test/Caviardage/Outils/CodePlex Word 2007 Redaction Tool/Word 2007 Redaction Tool.vsto

à Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Deployment.ClickOnceAddInDeploymentManager.VerifySolutionCodebaseIsUnchanged(Uri uri, String subscriptionId, Boolean previouslyInstalled)

à Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Deployment.ClickOnceAddInDeploymentManager.InstallAddIn()

So it thinks it is installed when it appears that it isn,t....

N.

So you don't see "Word 2007 Redaction Tool" in Add/Remove Programs? If you browse to file:///C:/DOCUME~1/Montour.IRO/LOCALS~1/Temp/WZSE0.TMP/Word 2007 Redaction Tool.vsto, is the original file still there? If so, can you double-click it (to try and reinstall it)?

Hello Tristand,

No, I do not have this file ;  I also uninstalled the .net for office SP1 thingy and reinstalled ;

I still get this error :

Name:

From: file:///E:/NormandMontour/CodePlex Word 2007 Redaction Tool/Word 2007 Redaction Tool.vsto

The customization cannot be installed because another version is currently installed and cannot be upgraded from this location. To install this version of the customization, first use Add or Remove Programs to uninstall this program: Word 2007 Redaction Tool. Then install the new customization from the following location: file:///E:/NormandMontour/CodePlex Word 2007 Redaction Tool/Word 2007 Redaction Tool.vsto

************** Exception Text **************

Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Deployment.AddInAlreadyInstalledException: The customization cannot be installed because another version is currently installed and cannot be upgraded from this location. To install this version of the customization, first use Add or Remove Programs to uninstall this program: Word 2007 Redaction Tool. Then install the new customization from the following location: file:///E:/NormandMontour/CodePlex Word 2007 Redaction Tool/Word 2007 Redaction Tool.vsto

à Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Deployment.ClickOnceAddInDeploymentManager.VerifySolutionCodebaseIsUnchanged(Uri uri, String subscriptionId, Boolean previouslyInstalled)

à Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Deployment.ClickOnceAddInDeploymentManager.InstallAddIn()

Still no Word 2007 redaction in my list of applications in config panel.

I do have the install log, is there an email address I can sent it to ?

Normand (you can also call me at 514-920-0020 x231)

Okay, let's try to brute-force remove the solution then..

If you can try this:

  1. Make sure nothing's in Add/Remove Programs from the reinstall attempt (sounds like not). If so, uninstall it.
  2. Search for vstoinstaller.exe on your hard drive (it should be in C:\Program Files\Common Files\microsoft shared\VSTO\9.0). Note that location.
  3. Search for *.vsto and locate the existing copy of the VSTO solution file for the add-in
  4. From the directory in #1, run VSTOinstaller /uninstall <path to the .vsto file>

The run Word and make sure things are clean (i.e. the add-in is gone and you get no error messages) before trying to reinstall it.

Hello Tristand,

   Things aren’t much clearer ; I tried to locate the .VSTO file anywhere on my “C:” drive and it did not find it.

I’m including the error log of the install, if it can be of any help.

Regards

Normand

Okay, let's try to brute-force remove the solution then..

If you can try this:

1. Make sure nothing's in Add/Remove Programs from the reinstall attempt (sounds like not). If so, uninstall it.

2. Search for vstoinstaller.exe on your hard drive (it should be in C:\Program Files\Common Files\microsoft shared\VSTO\9.0). Note that location.

3. Search for *.vsto and locate the existing copy of the VSTO solution file for the add-in

4. From the directory in #1, run VSTOinstaller /uninstall <path to the .vsto file>

The run Word and make sure things are clean (i.e. the add-in is gone and you get no error messages) before trying to reinstall it.

Hmm.. okay. At this point I'm a little stumped - let me speak to some people and see if I can come up with another solution.

Okay, next thing to try:

Can you edit the registry and delete this key if present: HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\Office\Word\Addins\CodePlex Word 2007 Redaction Tool? That should get us back to clean state from which we can reinstall.

Hello Tristand,

  I found the key (not exactly the text you mentioned (the word Codeplex was not there) ;

I deleted it, and tried install again ; same message :

Name:

From: file:///E:/NormandMontour/CodePlex Word 2007 Redaction Tool/Word 2007 Redaction Tool.vsto

The customization cannot be installed because another version is currently installed and cannot be upgraded from this location. To install this version of the customization, first use Add or Remove Programs to uninstall this program: Word 2007 Redaction Tool. Then install the new customization from the following location: file:///E:/NormandMontour/CodePlex Word 2007 Redaction Tool/Word 2007 Redaction Tool.vsto

************** Exception Text **************

Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Deployment.AddInAlreadyInstalledException: The customization cannot be installed because another version is currently installed and cannot be upgraded from this location. To install this version of the customization, first use Add or Remove Programs to uninstall this program: Word 2007 Redaction Tool. Then install the new customization from the following location: file:///E:/NormandMontour/CodePlex Word 2007 Redaction Tool/Word 2007 Redaction Tool.vsto

   à Microsoft.VisualStudio.Tools.Applications.Deployment.ClickOnceAddInDeploymentManager.VerifySolutionCodebaseIsUnchanged(Uri uri, String subscriptionId, Boolean previouslyInstalled)

I did find another Key under “Microsoft” which just called “Redaction” ; perhaps left over from the old Office2003 redaction tool.

There is another branch under Microsoft keys called VSTA which seem to contain “Redaction” in the Product name key.

I hope this helps.

Normand

Okay, next thing to try is totally clearing your ClickOnce cache.

Can you search for mage.exe on your machine and run mage -cc from that directory? If you don't have it, you will need to grab it from the Windows SDK from http://download.microsoft.com/.

Once you have it, run mage.exe -cc

and then we can try reinstalling again.

Hello Tristand,

OK - let me look into this. I'll let you know if I have any other ideas.

Hi Guys,

A few days ago, I have the same issue with my VSTO Outlook add-in.

After some experiments with system registry, I have discovered, that for the correct manual uninstall of the outlook customization you must to delete keys, which noted below as dynamic path.

 

NOTE:

Path to the key contain two parts:

-          bold selected, which correspond to the static path;

-          normal selected, which correspond to the dynamic path.

 

 

HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Classes\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Deployment\SideBySide\2.0\PackageMetadata\{2ec93463-b0c3-45e1-8364-327e96aea856}_{3f471841-eef2-47d6-89c0-d028f03a4ad5}

 

HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\Office\Outlook\Addins\CRMSyncOutlook

 

HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\VSTA\Solutions\83f1159f-b6d6-40de-a6a3-813c295756b8

 

HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\VSTO\Security\Inclusion\8fdb4cdc-5233-44b8-b714-dc597f4251c2

 

HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Uninstall\A038EC5F21C9FBBE3822442A3D67223DCCF1E5EC

 

 

Warning: Please back up your registry before you make any modification. About how to back up and restore your registry, you can refer the following KB article: http://support.microsoft.com/kb/322756 

 

It'll be great if it help you.

What do you think Tristand ?

Normand Montour

After some experiments with system registry, I have discovered, that for the correct manual uninstall of the outlook customization you must to delete keys, which noted below as dynamic path.

NOTE:

Path to the key contain two parts:

- bold selected, which correspond to the static path;

- normal selected, which correspond to the dynamic path.

HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Classes\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Deployment\SideBySide\2.0\PackageMetadata\{2ec93463-b0c3-45e1-8364-327e96aea856}_{3f471841-eef2-47d6-89c0-d028f03a4ad5}

HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\Office\Outlook\Addins\CRMSyncOutlook

HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\VSTA\Solutions\83f1159f-b6d6-40de-a6a3-813c295756b8

HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\VSTO\Security\Inclusion\8fdb4cdc-5233-44b8-b714-dc597f4251c2

HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Uninstall\A038EC5F21C9FBBE3822442A3D67223DCCF1E5EC

Warning: Please back up your registry before you make any modification. About how to back up and restore your registry, you can refer the following KB article: http://support.microsoft.com/kb/322756

It'll be great if it help you.

This should work - but as the poster said, editing the registry is a dangerous operation and could cause other issues.

If you do want to pursue this to get the add-in to work, the best thing to do to start would probably be to inventory the keys under the bold keys listed above. (i.e. don't make any edits, just list them out in a reply)
